comments.body:
I mainly learned from another e2e_test file.

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/197fc67693c2391dcbc652fc185ba85b5ef82a8e/test/e2e_node/security_context_test.go#L40

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/197fc67693c2391dcbc652fc185ba85b5ef82a8e/test/e2e_node/security_context_test.go#L226

I think, in the future, there may be other test case to be added to log_path_test, which may have some other different initializing operations than Context("printed log to stdout"). 

For example, if we want to test the file based logs, which may be considered in the future. 

But the first `BeforeEach`, which initialize variable podClient, is needed in every test case.

If my concern is not necessary , I can modify this into one `BeforeEach`
You are using single spec in this file, so you can use only one `BeforeEach`, this two `BeforeEach` will get execute in this spec, so you can make it one.
nit: The created pod is returned by `podClient.Create`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +67,71 @@
				// get containerID from created Pod
				createdLogPod, err := podClient.Get(logPodName)
				logConID := kubecontainer.ParseContainerID(createdLogPod.Status.ContainerStatuses[0].ContainerID)
				framework.ExpectNoError(err, "Failed to get pod: %s", logPodName)

comments.body: You don't need the UUID on any of these, since the each test is run in a separate namespace.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +43,47 @@				logContName := "logger-c-" + string(uuid.NewUUID())
				checkPodName := "checker" + string(uuid.NewUUID())
				checkContName := "checker-c-" + string(uuid.NewUUID())

				logPod := &api.Pod{
